title: Handling Low-Resource and Imbalanced Medical Data
author: Radiant Group
excerpt: Lessons learned from training medical AI systems under severe data constraints.
content:
## Context
Medical data scarcity is the norm, not the exception.

## Problem Statement
Small, biased datasets make standard training paradigms unreliable.

## Why More Data Is Not the Answer
Synthetic volume without semantic consistency degrades performance.

## Design Principles
- Error analysis first
- Feature-level augmentation
- Class-aware evaluation

## Technical Approach
We analyze failure modes before applying augmentation strategies.

## Evaluation
Performance is measured per-class, not globally.

## Limitations
Generalization remains bounded by data diversity.

## Lessons Learned
Robustness beats leaderboard metrics.

## Conclusion
Low-resource ML requires different success criteria.
